txt: \x"The world is full of colors"
txt_idk_1: 『世界は色で満ちている』
txt_idk_2: 『世界は色で満ちている』

txt: It's something ordinary and special that I was aware of as\na child.
This world is made up of many "colors".
When did I -Michitaka Shindou- learn this?
txt_idk_1: それを俺――しんどうみちたかが知ったのはいつだろう？
txt_idk_2: それを俺――新堂道隆が知ったのはいつだろう？

txt: I still remember the feeling of that hand.
The warmth of being connected and the kindness of the\nperson who guided me through the darkness.
So, I vaguely felt like I wanted to return the favor.
In return for all the help I've been given in the darkness.
The world gets its color back.
But it was a different thing than it had ever been.
The world is full of color.
Even now, the world is full of so many colors.
... the scenery I was looking at is nowhere to be found.
"... I guess that's just the way it is."
I sighed as I finished sorting through my room's stuff.
The sun, which had not fully risen when I left my parents' house, is now tilting in the western sky.
txt_idk_1: 実家を出た時にはまだ昇りきっていなかった太陽が、今はもう西の空に傾いている。
txt_idk_2: 実家を出た時にはまだ昇りきっていなかった太陽が、今はもう西の空に傾いている。

txt: After a simple cleaning, dusting and packing.
Furniture needed for daily life had been provided, so as\nlong as the futon was hung out to dry and the moisture\nwas removed, tonight's bed will be no problem.
txt_idk_1: 生活に必要な最低限の家具は元から用意されていたから、布団を干して湿気を払えば、今日の寝床は問題ない。
txt_idk_2: 生活に必要な最低限の家具は元から用意されていたから、布団を干して湿気を払えば、今日の寝床は問題ない。

txt: I looked around the small Japanese-style room.
An old-fasioned bookshelf and a desk.\nThen the futon was folded.
txt_idk_1: 古めかしい本棚に机。それから畳まれた布団。
txt_idk_2: 古めかしい本棚に机。それから畳まれた布団。

txt: The TV in the corner of the room is old, and now that\nwe've switched to terrestrial, it's probably only used for\ngames or videos.
txt_idk_1: 部屋の隅にあるテレビは年代物で、地デジに切り替わった現在では、ゲームかビデオの用途にしかならないだろう。
txt_idk_2: 部屋の隅にあるテレビは年代物で、地デジに切り替わった現在では、ゲームかビデオの用途にしかならないだろう。

txt: I'll deal with this later.
However, when I think that this room is where I will be\nliving by myself from today on, the type of television\nseems like a minor issue.
txt_idk_1: とはいえ、この部屋が今日から俺が一人で暮らす場所だと思うと、テレビの型なんて些細な事に思えてくる。
txt_idk_2: とはいえ、この部屋が今日から俺が一人で暮らす場所だと思うと、テレビの型なんて些細な事に思えてくる。

txt: Living alone.
Your very own castle.
At our age, I don't think there's anyone who isn't\nattracted to these words.
txt_idk_1: 俺たちぐらいの年齢で、この言葉に惹かれないヤツはいないだろう。
txt_idk_2: 俺たちぐらいの年齢で、この言葉に惹かれないヤツはいないだろう。

txt: Even if it's only for a little while, I can say that I'm very\nlucky to be able to live alone.
txt_idk_1: それが少しの間だけとはいえ、一人暮らしが出来るんだからとてもツイてると言ってもいい。
txt_idk_2: それが少しの間だけとはいえ、一人暮らしが出来るんだからとてもツイてると言ってもいい。

txt: .... Well, it looks like there are going to be a lot of things,\nbut it's good to think about it after it gets tough.
txt_idk_1: ……ま、何かと大変な事もありそうだけど、そんなのは大変になってから考えればいい事だ。
txt_idk_2: ……ま、何かと大変な事もありそうだけど、そんなのは大変になってから考えればいい事だ。

txt: "Michitaka-kun? Are you done?"
My name was called from outside.\nI looked out the window and looked down to see a woman waving at me.
txt_idk_1: 外から名前を呼ばれた。窓から顔を出して下を見ると、女の人が手を振っている。
txt_idk_2: 外から名前を呼ばれた。窓から顔を出して下を見ると、女の人が手を振っている。

txt: She's my cousin, who is the landlord who lives next door.
"I'm on my way!"
I replied loudly and went back to my room.
Well... A new life will begin in this room.
What will happen?\nI remember the beginning of this.
txt_idk_1: どんな事が起こるのか。こんな事になった発端を思い出していた。
txt_idk_2: どんな事が起こるのか。こんな事になった発端を思い出していた。

txt: "Are you willing to live on your own?"
It was just the other day that my father told me that.
It's about that time when I have to think about my career.\nSo, I replied nonchalantly.
txt_idk_1: そろそろ進路を考えなくちゃいけない年齢になってきている。だから、何の気なしに答えた。
txt_idk_2: そろそろ進路を考えなくちゃいけない年齢になってきている。だから、何の気なしに答えた。

txt: "I have"
Next semester will be my second school year. The college\nexam is in my junior year and I may need to move into a\ndorm. Or rent a room somewhere...
txt_idk_1: 新学期が始まれば学年も２年になる。３年になったら受験だし、行く大学によっては寮に入るかどこかに部屋を借りるか……。
txt_idk_2: 新学期が始まれば学年も２年になる。３年になったら受験だし、行く大学によっては寮に入るかどこかに部屋を借りるか……。

txt: Either way, I'll be leaving this house.
My father nodded at my reply.
"I see, I see.\nThen you know the building next door to Fujimiya-san's\nhouse, right?"
"Hmm?\nYeah, I think that's where grandpa used to live alone.\nI've been there before, but..."
txt_idk_1: 「ん？　ああ、確か爺さんが一人で住んでた所だろ。昔、遊び行った事あるけど……」
txt_idk_2: 「ん？　ああ、確か爺さんが一人で住んでた所だろ。昔、遊び行った事あるけど……」

txt: But it would have been an unoccupied house that hasn't\nbeen used since the old man died.
txt_idk_1: でも、そこは爺さんが死んでから使われてない無人の家屋だったはずだ。
txt_idk_2: でも、そこは爺さんが死んでから使われてない無人の家屋だったはずだ。

txt: I was about to continue, but he interrupted my words and\nwent on.
"Then go there.\nWe're in the neighborhood, so you don't have to transfer,\nand you can at least come over if you're hungry."
txt_idk_1: 「じゃ、そこに行ってこい。近所だから転校の必要もないし、腹が減ったら飯ぐらいは食いに来てもいい」
txt_idk_2: 「じゃ、そこに行ってこい。近所だから転校の必要もないし、腹が減ったら飯ぐらいは食いに来てもいい」

txt: 「いやだからな」
He said to himself, "I don't understand him."
"The sooner you get used to it, the better.\nYou should go tomorrow."
"...... Really?"
While I was taken aback, my father nodded his head\nearnestly.
...... Even in retrospect, it seems so sudden.
The next day was unreasonable, so I prepared for one day\nand carried the luggage in my father's car today,\nand here we are.
txt_idk_1: さすがに翌日は無茶だったので、一日準備をして今日親父の車で荷物を運びこんで、今に至る。
txt_idk_2: さすがに翌日は無茶だったので、一日準備をして今日親父の車で荷物を運びこんで、今に至る。

txt: I'll have to use the furniture and whatever else that\nis already there. It's a good idea to have a little bit of time to think about what to do.
txt_idk_1: 家具なんかは元からある物を使わせて貰う。運び込んだ荷物も、殆どが俺の服や学園に使う物、趣味の物ばかりだった。
txt_idk_2: 家具なんかは元からある物を使わせて貰う。運び込んだ荷物も、殆どが俺の服や学園に使う物、趣味の物ばかりだった。

txt: In any case, there are several reasons why I took such a\nfool's errand.
txt_idk_1: ともあれ、そんな無茶に乗ってしまったのもいくつか理由がある。
txt_idk_2: ともあれ、そんな無茶に乗ってしまったのもいくつか理由がある。

txt: The first reason was that I wanted live alone.
Second, there was no need to transfer to a new school\nand it was in the same city.
Then......
"What's wrong?"
This is the person walking next to me.
Fujimiya Chitose
txt_idk_1: ふじみやちとせさん。
txt_idk_2: 藤宮千歳さん。

txt: Chitose-san is the older sister of my cousin who also lives\nin the same city.
Since Sakurahasou, the building I live in, belongs to her\nfamily, she is the real landlord.
txt_idk_1: 俺の住む桜花荘は彼女の家の物だから、実質的な大家さんに当たる。
txt_idk_2: 俺の住む桜花荘は彼女の家の物だから、実質的な大家さんに当たる。

txt: I'm a stranger and I'd do the same, but it's a relative next\ndoor and I don't need the rent.
txt_idk_1: 見ず知らずの所だと尻ごみもするけど、すぐ隣が親類だし家賃も要らない。
txt_idk_2: 見ず知らずの所だと尻ごみもするけど、すぐ隣が親類だし家賃も要らない。

txt: On the contrary, I hope that I can enjoy the room\ncompletely by myself, unlike my small house.
txt_idk_1: それどころか、狭い俺の家と違って完全に一人の部屋を謳歌出来るのだから願ったりだ。
txt_idk_2: それどころか、狭い俺の家と違って完全に一人の部屋を謳歌出来るのだから願ったりだ。

txt: "I thought it was an unfamiliar sight..."
"Fufu, sure."
Both Chitose-san and I have a bag in our hands since we\nbought essential daily necessities.
txt_idk_1: 当面の生活必需品を買いこんで、俺も千歳さんも両手に荷物を持っている。
txt_idk_2: 当面の生活必需品を買いこんで、俺も千歳さんも両手に荷物を持っている。

txt: Walking around with a shopping bag in our hands is an\nunfamiliar sight for the both of us.
"It's fine if you come to my house to eat,\nbut there's also also the timing of your life,\nso you'll have to cook for yourself..."
txt_idk_1: 「食事はうちに来て貰ってもいいんだけど、生活のタイミングもあるから、自炊もして貰うとして……」
txt_idk_2: 「食事はうちに来て貰ってもいいんだけど、生活のタイミングもあるから、自炊もして貰うとして……」

txt: "Is there anything else I've forgotten to buy?"
"I'm not sure, I'll go back and buy some more if I run out."
txt_idk_1: 「良くわからないんで、足りなかったらまた買いに行ってきますよ」
txt_idk_2: 「良くわからないんで、足りなかったらまた買いに行ってきますよ」

txt: "That's true, too. I'm right next door,\nso don't hesitate to tell me if you have any problems."
txt_idk_1: 「それもそうね。すぐ隣だから、困った事があったら遠慮なく言ってちょうだい」
txt_idk_2: 「それもそうね。すぐ隣だから、困った事があったら遠慮なく言ってちょうだい」

txt: "Thank you very much."
"... But before coming over, Michitaka-kun"
Chitose-san looks up.
When I was caught and looked in her direction,\nI saw a girl waving at in the distance.
"Shione-chan seems to meddling, though."
txt_idk_1: 「しおねがお節介焼きに行きそうだけどね」
txt_idk_2: 「汐音がお節介焼きに行きそうだけどね」

txt: "... Surely"
"Ahhh. You're already done shopping!?"
"So you see. I was just about to leave."
"Ugh~. I see. Too bad."
"Did you need something?"
"No, it's nothing like that, but instead it's a welcome party\nfor a housewarming celebration, so I thought I'd like to\nhave some sukiyaki."
txt_idk_1: 「ううん、そうじゃないんだけど、今日はせっかくの新居祝いに歓迎会なんだから、すき焼きが食べたいなーって思って」
txt_idk_2: 「ううん、そうじゃないんだけど、今日はせっかくの新居祝いに歓迎会なんだから、すき焼きが食べたいなーって思って」

txt: "The both of us left our bags behind and our cell phones\nwere turned off..."
"Is that what you want to eat?"
Chitose-san chided her, and the girl shrugged.
This girl is Fujimiya Shione.
txt_idk_1: この子はふじみやしおね。
txt_idk_2: この子は藤宮汐音。

txt: She's Chitose-san's sister and my cousin of the same age.
Of course, we're also classmates that go to the same\nclass, so it's a bit late to be told that they're going to\nhave a welcoming party at their new home.
txt_idk_1: もっとも同じクラスに通っていたクラスメートでもあるから、新居に歓迎会と言われても、まさしく今さらの話だ。
txt_idk_2: もっとも同じクラスに通っていたクラスメートでもあるから、新居に歓迎会と言われても、まさしく今さらの話だ。

txt: "Here, help me with this, take it."
"Yeesss"
She took half of the bags from Chitose-san and\nlined up next to me.
"I guess this means we're going to travel to school\ntogether, during the new semester."
"Oh, I see. How am I supposed to get there from here?\nShione-chan rides the bike to school, don't you?"
txt_idk_1: 「あ、そっか。こっちからだとどうやって行けばいいんだ？汐音はずっと自転車通学してたよな」
txt_idk_2: 「あ、そっか。こっちからだとどうやって行けばいいんだ？汐音はずっと自転車通学してたよな」

txt: "Yeah. But if you have a bike, you have to register for bike\nparking. It's a new semester and we're all going out at\nonce, so it might be just right."
txt_idk_1: 「うん。でも自転車なら駐輪場の登録が必要になるよ。新学期だからみんな一斉に出すから、ちょうどいいかも」
txt_idk_2: 「うん。でも自転車なら駐輪場の登録が必要になるよ。新学期だからみんな一斉に出すから、ちょうどいいかも」

txt: "I wonder if I'll do the same then.\nI don't have any other means of transportation."
"You could walk, but it would take more than half an hour.\nI think it's about ten minutes on a bike."
txt_idk_1: 「歩いてもいけるけど、３０分以上かかるしね。自転車だと１０分くらいかな」
txt_idk_2: 「歩いてもいけるけど、３０分以上かかるしね。自転車だと１０分くらいかな」

txt: "...it takes 10 minutes to get there by bike and 30 minutes\non foot?!"
txt_idk_1: 「……自転車で１０分かかる道のりを、歩いて３０分程度で着くもんなのか？」
txt_idk_2: 「……自転車で１０分かかる道のりを、歩いて３０分程度で着くもんなのか？」

txt: When I questioned myself, Chitose-chan made a small\nspeech buble.
"It's too difficult to explain. If you walk, you have to take a\nroad that bikes aren't allowed on."
txt_idk_1: 「説明はしょりすぎでしょ。歩く場合は、自転車じゃ通れない道を行くのよね」
txt_idk_2: 「説明はしょりすぎでしょ。歩く場合は、自転車じゃ通れない道を行くのよね」

txt: "Yeah. If you go through the forest where the shrine is,\nyou reach the other side, so there aren't any traffic lights\nat the intersection and it's faster."
txt_idk_1: 「うん。神社のある森を通らせて貰うと、すぐに反対側に出るから、交差点の信号待ちも無いし早いんだよ」
txt_idk_2: 「うん。神社のある森を通らせて貰うと、すぐに反対側に出るから、交差点の信号待ちも無いし早いんだよ」

txt: "I see."
If you live in a different place, the route to school is also\nvery different.
It's a great way to discover new things about the school\nyou're used to going to.
While we were talking about such things, Sakurahasou\ncame into view.
"I'll see you later then.\nI'll be there as soon as I drop my stuff off."
"The refrigerator is the same as the one my grandpa used,\nso I think it can be used even if it's a little old.\nMake sure you put the raw stuff in it right away."
txt_idk_1: 「冷蔵庫なんかもおじいちゃんが使っていた物そのままだから少し型は古くても使えると思う。生ものはすぐに入れてね」
txt_idk_2: 「冷蔵庫なんかもおじいちゃんが使っていた物そのままだから少し型は古くても使えると思う。生ものはすぐに入れてね」

txt: "Thank you for everything you've done."
"It's okay. It would have been nice if Michitaka-kun\nhad lived there."
I wondered slightly at those words.
"Can I ask you something?"
I turn to the sisters in front of me and ask them what I\nthought.
"No one has lived in this house since my grandfather died,\nright?"
txt_idk_1: 「この家って、じいさんが死んでから誰も住んでないんですよね」
txt_idk_2: 「この家って、じいさんが死んでから誰も住んでないんですよね」

txt: "Well, now you do."
"And I'm not renting it..."
"This is Michitaka-kun's first time?"
"Have the either of you two thought of living there?"
Then you can make a whole large house into your own\nroom.
I'm sure you'll have to go through the hassle of eating and\ncleaning, but as Chitose-san said earlier, you can go home to your own house right next door to eat.
txt_idk_1: 食事や掃除やらの手間はあるだろうし手間だけど、それこそさっき千歳さんが言ったように、食事はすぐ隣の自分の家まで帰ってもいいはずだ。
txt_idk_2: 食事や掃除やらの手間はあるだろうし手間だけど、それこそさっき千歳さんが言ったように、食事はすぐ隣の自分の家まで帰ってもいいはずだ。

txt: At my question, the two of them looked at each other.
"... Maybe you don't know..."
"No way. You used to come here and play as a kid many\ntimes before..."
"Hey, uh... Hey, um.... Excuse me?"
"Hey, Taka-chan"
Shione turns around to face this way.
The seriousness of her face made me feel uncomfortable.
"It's nothing to stand around and talk about,\nlet's talk about it later?"
"I don't mind, but..."
"Okay, sis."
"Yeah, I'll see you later then."
The two of them went to the house next door - their home.
As they walked away, I heard Chitose-san's mummbling.
"I'm troubled...\nUncle, I hope you haven't told him yet.\nWhat if Michitaka-kun is scared..."
txt_idk_1: 「困ったわね……おじさん、伝えていないのかしら。道隆君が怖がったらどうしよう……」
txt_idk_2: 「困ったわね……おじさん、伝えていないのかしら。道隆君が怖がったらどうしよう……」

txt: What the hell have you been hiding, old man...!!!
With a feeling of incomprehension,\nI walked into Sakurahasou.
(She said that I didn't know or that I'd been here when I\nwas a kid...)
txt_idk_1: （俺が知らないとか、子供の頃に来た事が……って言ってたよな……）
txt_idk_2: （俺が知らないとか、子供の頃に来た事が……って言ってたよな……）

txt: And it seemed very hard to talk about.
This building, Sakurahasou, is the building our\ngrandfather lived in.
After retiring at an advanced age, he lived the rest of his\nlife in seclusion in this ancient building that had been\nhanded down from generation to generation.
txt_idk_1: 何でも老成して引退した後は、先祖代々受け継がれてきたこの古めかしい建物にこもり、ひっそりと余生を過ごしていたらしい。
txt_idk_2: 何でも老成して引退した後は、先祖代々受け継がれてきたこの古めかしい建物にこもり、ひっそりと余生を過ごしていたらしい。

txt: At that time, the Fujimiya family didn't live next door,\nand their father built the house afterwards because he\nwas worried about his father who had reached his old age.
txt_idk_1: その時にはまだ隣の藤宮家も無く、老境に達した爺さんが心配だと、彼女たちのお父さんが後から建てた家だそうだ。
txt_idk_2: その時にはまだ隣の藤宮家も無く、老境に達した爺さんが心配だと、彼女たちのお父さんが後から建てた家だそうだ。

txt: When we were kids, he was still going strong and\nwe used to come visit often because we lived in the same\ncity.
txt_idk_1: 俺たちが子供の頃はまだ健在で、同じ市内というのもあってちょくちょく遊びに来ていた。
txt_idk_2: 俺たちが子供の頃はまだ健在で、同じ市内というのもあってちょくちょく遊びに来ていた。

txt: But most of them weren't there to see the old man.
As a child, the antiquated building fueled his adventurous\nspirit, and took a scared Shione-chan along with him as he\nran through it.
txt_idk_1: 子供心に古めかしい建物は冒険心を煽られて、怖がる汐音を連れて、この建物の中を走り回っていた。
txt_idk_2: 子供心に古めかしい建物は冒険心を煽られて、怖がる汐音を連れて、この建物の中を走り回っていた。

txt: Then I remembered.
The nickname that was given to this building at the time.
It is...
"... Haunted house..."
A white shadow crossed my vision.
It left the front room and went to the back stairs and\ndisappeared upstairs.
txt_idk_1: それは手前の部屋から出て奥の階段に向かい、二階へと消えていった。
txt_idk_2: それは手前の部屋から出て奥の階段に向かい、二階へと消えていった。

txt: I rub my eyes. There's nothing to see there.\nThere was no white shadow left either.
txt_idk_1: 目をこすってみる。そこには何も見えない。色も残っていなかった。
txt_idk_2: 目をこすってみる。そこには何も見えない。色も残っていなかった。

txt: No no no no!!!!
That was when I was a kid!
First of all,\nI've been there all day and there's nothing there!
But when I turn around and look up at the sky,\nthe sun is tilting and turning madder.
txt_idk_1: でも振りかえって空を見上げると、太陽が傾いて茜色が差してきている。
txt_idk_2: でも振りかえって空を見上げると、太陽が傾いて茜色が差してきている。

txt: The sun is slower than before when I went out shopping,\nand night is about to come.
If anything is going to happen, it's more fitting than\ndaytime.
"Seriously..."
Is this why you two were so suspicious a moment ago?
No one wanted to live in this house because it was\nhaunted by a real person?
I swallowed my salavia.
I struggled a bit, maybe because I was so nervous.
"Hey there."
"Did you wait for me?"
I was startled by the momentum of my shaking,\nor maybe I was startled by the two surprised faces.
txt_idk_1: 振りかえる俺の勢いに驚いたのか――びっくりした顔の二人がいた。
txt_idk_2: 振りかえる俺の勢いに驚いたのか――びっくりした顔の二人がいた。
